room.room: Rooms are just the XML-World equivalent of DIVs. They can be nested. They can contain objects, agents, and other rooms. <-->

face.div:
This is the appearance of the object.
Classic HTML5 here! The Ai doesn't natively understand this HTML, but it can learn to recognize features, common points, ...etc. <-->

object.body: This is the content of the object. It can contain nested objects and agents. <-->

face.p: That's another HTML5 section, for the appearance of this agent. Same as objects faces.

agent.body: That's the content of an agent. It can contain nested objects, that an agent would be "carrying". <-->

object.body:
The "aspect" attribute can have the following values: * opaque (default) * transparent * hidden Agents cannot see the body tag of an opaque object. Agents cannot see beyond an opaque object (subjective view explained later). Agents cannot see an hidden object. <-->
I'm not hidden because my container is transparent!

room.object:
Object example - fixed objects
Objects with attribute "fixed" cannot be taken away (carried) by agents. They cannot be moved to another place. <-->

Object example - openable objects
Objects with attribute "openable" can be open or closed. Agents cannot access the content of the body of closed objects. Agents cannot see the content of the body of closed objects. The "access" attribute can have the following values: * open (default) * closed <-->

Object example - openable objects
Objects with attribute "enterable" can be entered by agents. The "access" attribute controls whether the object is currently closed (impossible to enter) or open (possible to enter). It is the same "access" attribute that controls also the possibility of accessing the body of an openable object. <-->

Object example - scripted objects
strength direction (north south west east)
velocity of the ball
Objects with attribute "script" have an associated API defined in the Js file given as attribute value. The content of the "method" & "property" tags is a natural language description of the method/property. Ai can learn to recognize these descriptions. <-->
